intro: Sauvallea blainii, commonly known as the Blain's sauvallea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
